pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, June 3, 2019 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

 Gatineau, Quebec

 9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will attend the closing ceremony of the National Inquiry into Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls and the presentation of its Final Report, and will deliver remarks. Sophie Grégoire Trudeau, Minister of Crown-Indigenous Relations Carolyn Bennett, Minister of Justice and Attorney General of Canada David Lametti, and Minister of Indigenous Services Seamus O’Regan will be in attendance.

Canadian Museum of History
100 Laurier Street

Notes for media:

  • Pooled coverage

Vancouver, British Columbia

4:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks and participate in a panel discussion at the opening of the Women Deliver 2019 Conference.

Plenary Hall
Vancouver Convention Centre
1055 Canada Place

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage for media accredited by the Women Deliver Conference: https://wd2019.org/media/
  • Media are asked to arrive at the Media center no later than 3:15 p.m.
  • Media entrance via the West Pacific Terrace

7:15 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the President of Ghana, Nana Addo Dankwa Akufo-Addo.

Vancouver Convention Centre
1055 Canada Place

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting (stills and video only)
  • Media are asked to check in at Room 121 in the Media Centre (West Ballroom D) no later than 6:30 p.m.  

8:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the President of Kenya, Uhuru Kenyatta.

Vancouver Convention Centre
1055 Canada Place

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity at the beginning of the meeting (stills and video only)
  • Media are asked to check in at Room 121 in the Media Centre (West Ballroom D) no later than 6:30 p.m.
